intro: Cecropia mituana, commonly known as the velvet ceiba, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant has a distinctive trunk that is often covered in a thick, velvety layer of moss, giving it its common name. It plays an important ecological role in providing habitat and food for various species. The seeds are dispersed by animals, contributing to its wide distribution in forested areas.
